availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alexander L. Caldwell (Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier/23rd Kentucky Infantry)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William Caldwell and Elizabeth Caldwell. Married to Elizabeth Caldwell. Father of Ardora Caldwell and Sarah Caldwell. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860. Private in the 23rd Regiment Kentucky Volunteer Infantry from December 1861 to June 1862.

bibl.p: Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 355; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 42; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Pendleton County, precinct 8, p. 22; Find A Grave, "Alexander Lincoln Caldwell (1834-1917)," Memorial #62661933, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=62661933&ref=acom (accessed March 30, 2017).
